title: New England Clam Chowder (Sourdough Bowl)
description: A creamy, comforting New England clam chowder finished with tender clams and smoky bacon, served inside hollowed sourdough bowls for an iconic presentation. Rich, savory broth with potatoes, onions and celery, thickened gently with cream and a bit of flour for classic mouthfeel.

ingredients.display_name: fresh cherrystone or littleneck clams (in shell)
ingredients.notes: about 1.5–2 lb total in shell; scrubbed and rinsed
use clam juice for stronger clams flavor if desired
adds body; can use half-and-half for richer finish
adjust to taste; account for clam/stock saltiness
one per serving; hollowed leaving 1/2-inch shell
for browning or coating bread edges if desired

steps.text: Clean clams: scrub shells under cold running water and discard any open clams that do not close when tapped; set clams aside refrigerated.
Cook bacon in a large heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat until fat is rendered and bacon is crisp; remove bacon with a slotted spoon to a paper towel-lined plate and reserve bacon fat in the pot.
Add butter to the reserved bacon fat; when foaming subsides, add diced onion and celery and sweat over medium-low heat until translucent and soft.
Stir in minced garlic and cook briefly until fragrant, about a minute, then sprinkle flour over the vegetables and cook, stirring constantly, for 1–2 minutes to remove raw flour taste.
Gradually whisk in chicken stock (or clam juice) to create a smooth broth, then add diced potatoes, bay leaves and thyme; bring to a simmer and cook until potatoes are just tender.

Meanwhile steam clams in a covered pot with a couple tablespoons of water or a splash of stock over medium-high heat until shells open, about 5–6 minutes; discard any unopened clams, remove clams from shells reserving the cooking liquid, and roughly chop half the meat, leaving the rest whole.

Strain the reserved clam steaming liquid through a fine mesh sieve into the chowder pot and adjust liquid level if necessary; stir in milk and cream and heat gently—do not boil—to avoid cream separation.
Add chopped and whole clam meat to the pot along with cooked bacon pieces; warm through for 2–3 minutes to meld flavors, taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
Prepare sourdough bowls by cutting lids and hollowing out centers leaving a sturdy shell; optionally brush cut edges with olive oil and toast briefly in a 350°F (175°C) oven until slightly crisp.
Ladle chowder into prepared sourdough bowls, garnish with chopped parsley and reserved crisp bacon, and serve immediately with the bread lids on the side.
